metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30641 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.39 to 2.4.46 Unexpected matching behavior with 'MergeSlashes OFF'

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-30641` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-macro - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> looks like this was introduced in the patch for CVE-2019-0220, which was backported to bionic.

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1').
apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1').
